title.narrative: Radialistas + RadiosLibres: Community radio production and support for advocacy and awareness raising

description.narrative:
Radialistas Apasionadas y Apasionados (until 31/12/2016: Fundacion Radialistas Apasionadas y Apasionados) was created in 2001 to contribute to the democratisation of communications, especially of radio, with particular focus on gender, citizenship and protection of the environment. It was set up as a production and training centre for radio broadcasters from all continents, although prioritising Latin America and the Caribbean. During these past 18 years, Radialistas have worked to expand their services, and with Radioteca.net, Radios Libres and RadioLAB, they have consolidated their position as one of the most renown radio production and training centres in the region.
This new project is aimed at ensuring the continuation of Radialistas’ work so far, while also providing them with the space, time and stability they need to ensure their own sustainability by way of transforming themselves into a radio production and training services consultancy firm.
At the end of this project Radialistas hope that at least 3,000 community radios in Latin America will be having continued access to quality radio productions and training content saved on the Radialistas and Radios Libres websites and social media, and will be using these resources for their own productions and radio stations.
Radialistas also hope that community radio stations in Latin America will continue to recognise the political importance of using open source software as a precondition for democratising communications in the digital era. To achieve the above two objectives, they will be producing articles, manuals and video tutorials, and supporting the Network for Community Radios and Free Software. They will also maintain the technical infrastructure needed to operate their platforms and guarantee the virtual exchange of radio productions between regional community radios.
